title: How to Add a Local User Account to a Windows 10 or 11 PC

steps.title: Open your Windows Settings.
steps.content: Open your Windows Settings. Click the Start button and select the gear icon to do so . You can also press Windows key + i at the same time to open Settings .

steps.title: Click Accounts.
steps.content: Click Accounts .

steps.title: Select Family & other people from the left pane.
steps.content: Select Family & other people from the left pane.

steps.title: Click + Add someone else to this PC.
steps.content: Click + Add someone else to this PC . It's under the "Other people" category at the bottom, which means you might have to scroll down. Doing so will prompt a window to appear.

steps.title: Click I don't have this person's sign-in information.
steps.content: Click I don't have this person's sign-in information . It's the link at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Click Add a user without a Microsoft account.
steps.content: Click Add a user without a Microsoft account .

steps.title: Enter the user details and click Next.
steps.content: Enter the user details and click Next . Type a username and enter a password the new user will use to log in to the PC. You can also add a password hint in case the user forgets their password. Once you click Next , the new local account will be ready to use.

steps.title: Open your Windows Settings.
steps.content: Open your Windows Settings. Click the Start button and select the gear icon to do so. You can also press Windows key + i at the same time to open Settings.

steps.title: Click Accounts in the left panel.
steps.content: Click Accounts in the left panel. If you donâ€™t see the left panel, you'll need to expand the window until it appears.

steps.title: Click Other users.
steps.content: Click Other users . You'll see this in the right panel under the "Account settings" header.

steps.title: Click Add account.
steps.content: Click Add account . This will pop up a Microsoft login window, but you'll still be able to bypass it and make the account local.

steps.title: Click I don't have this person's sign-in information.
steps.content: Click I don't have this person's sign-in information . Another Microsoft window will appear.

steps.title: Click Add a user without a Microsoft account.
steps.content: Click Add a user without a Microsoft account . This opens the "Create a user for this PC" window. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Enter this user's account information.
steps.content: Enter this user's account information. Type a username for the person who needs to use the PC, then enter and confirm a password. You will also need to enter some security questions the user can use if they forget their password.

steps.title: Click Next to create the local account.
steps.content: Click Next to create the local account. The new user can now use their username and password to log in to this PC.

steps.title: Open your Windows Settings.
steps.content: Open your Windows Settings. If you want your new local user to be able to log in as an administrator , you can make a quick change to their account type. Click the Start button and select the gear icon to do so. You can also press Windows key + i at the same time to open Settings. If you just created the new local user and haven't closed your account settings yet, jump down to step 4 .

steps.title: Click Accounts.
steps.content: Click Accounts . You'll see this in the left panel in Windows 11. On Windows 10, just click the Accounts icon.

steps.title: Click Family & other users (Windows 10) or Other users (Windows 11).
steps.content: Click Family & other users (Windows 10) or Other users (Windows 11).

steps.title: Click the local user you want to make an administrator.
steps.content: Click the local user you want to make an administrator. You'll see a list of all users under "Other users." Any local accounts will be marked "Local account." Accounts that are already administrators will display "Administrator" below their names.

steps.title: Click Change account type next to the user's name.
steps.content: Click Change account type next to the user's name.

steps.title: Select Administrator from the menu and click OK.
steps.content: Select Administrator from the menu and click OK . This gives the selected local user account administrative rights for this computer. [2] X Research source
